channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tupperware’s sale to lenders approved by bankruptcy judge, keeping the iconic food containers on shelves
item.description: Under terms of the deal, a group of lenders is buying Tupperware’s brand name and various operating assets for $23.5 million in cash and more than $63...

item.title: Supreme Court temporarily halts lower court ruling ordering 1,600 voters back on Virginia voter rolls
item.description: Virginia filed for an emergency stay, seeking to halt the reinstatement of 1,600 voters ordered by a lower court.

item.title: Biden calls Trump supporters 'garbage'
item.description: President Biden called supporters of former President Donald Trump human garbage on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump tells supporters to 'please forgive' Biden for 'garbage' comment
item.description: Former President Donald Trump urged his followers to forgive President Biden for calling them human garbage.

item.title: Unlocking Stock Market Success: Why You Should Embrace the Skew
item.description: By learning to appreciate positive skew and its associated tail events, investors can unlock the full potential of stock market gains.

item.title: Trans-Affirming ‘Doctor’ Hides Evidence Kids Are Being Harmed
item.description: Everything about Big Trans in America is a lie — a lie propped up by a complicit public health bureaucracy.

item.title: The Illegal-Immigrant Burden on Medicaid and Tax-Subsidized Care Is Growing
item.description: Fewer American taxpayers are supporting a growing population of Medicaid recipients and an unchecked influx of illegal immigrants.

item.title: ‘Founder mode’ startup guru Paul Graham explains why he’s not backing Trump—‘He ran the White House like a mob boss’
item.description: Y Combinator co-founder Paul Graham calls Trump a 'crook' that cannot be trusted with the nation's highest office.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: From Tweets to Trades: The Hidden Risks of Social Media in Investing
item.description: Are you able to step outside the confines of social media echo chambers to make informed investment decisions?

item.title: Speech Tyranny in the U.K.?
item.description: Workplaces, colleges, and even pubs would likely face severe restrictions on speech rights under a new Labour bill.

item.title: Montana Supreme Court Goes After AG Austin Knudsen’s Law License As He Seeks Reelection
item.description: Montana’s supreme court is improperly using the attorney discipline system, which it controls, as a weapon in a political dispute.

item.title: Calling Republicans ‘Deplorable’ Was A Scandal Eight Years Ago. Now It’s The Democrats’ Platform
item.description: Clinton apologized for remarks that defined elite contempt for Trump supporters which has since become a staple of the Democrats' campaigns.

item.title: Biden says he wants to take pro-Trump comedian who made Puerto Rico joke 'for a swim'
item.description: President Biden said on Tuesday that he wants to take pro-Trump comedian Tony Hinchliffe "for a swim" after the comic’s controversial remarks at Sunda...

item.title: Trump, Harris will make final pitch to North Carolina voters in overlapping rallies on Wednesday
item.description: Both former President Trump and Vice President Harris will hold rallies in North Carolina on Wednesday afternoon, just six days before Election Day.

item.title: What Will the Election Mean for Antitrust?
item.description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump might recognize the danger of overregulation. Or they might give in to ideology and personal spats.

item.title: Trump and Vance will make America competitive again, former U.S. Patent Office director says
item.description: China leads in 37 of 44 critical technologies, Andrei Iancu, who served as director of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office under Trump, warns.

item.title: Reeves lifts U.K. taxes by £40 billion in first Labour budget
item.description: “The scale and seriousness of the situation that we have inherited cannot be underestimated,” Reeves said in the House of Commons on Wednesday, the fi...

item.title: Harris' closing argument focused on bashing Trump

item.title: Democracy Is Alive and Well in Brian Kemp’s Georgia
item.description: Record early-voting turnout in Georgia is a reminder that the state’s voting laws are voter-friendly, not ‘Jim Crow 2.0.’

item.title: Bloomington (Ind.) Journal
item.description: Sights and sounds in an outstanding American college town.

item.title: Trump Aims For A National Mandate With Massive Madison Square Garden Rally
item.description: Trump’s Madison Square Garden rally wasn't simply a campaign stop in an unwinnable state. It was a bid to unify and rally a national coalition.

item.title: Trump proclaims MAGA 'greatest political movement' in U.S. history
item.description: Former President Donald Trump returned to Pennsylvania on Tuesday to make a final appeal to Keystone State voters and their 19 Electoral College votes...

item.title: Alabama man who threatened Fani Willis sentenced to 21 months in prison, issues tearful apology
item.description: Arthur Ray Hanson II was sentenced to nearly two years in prison for leaving threatening phone messages for Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willi...

item.title: About 475 damaged ballots retrieved from burned drop box in Washington state, auditor says
item.description: About 475 damaged ballots were retrieved from a ballot box that was burned early Monday in southwest Washington, a county official said Tuesday.

item.title: Major pro-life group knocks on 4 million doors in 2024 swing states
item.description: Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America says it has knocked on 4 million doors and reached 10 million voters as part of its largest ground game in any elect...

item.title: Wall Street’s Latest Flood: Private Credit
item.description: Private credit is a treacherous swamp full of opportunists. Is your consultant capable of defying the formidable odds of success?

item.description: Kamala Harris has leveraged the legal system to jail Americans who engage in efforts to protect preborn children for the majority of her political car...

item.title: AI’s Game-Changing Potential in Banking: Are You Ready for the Regulatory Risks?
item.description: As regulators continue to refine their understanding of AI and big data, financial institutions have an opportunity to shape the regulatory landscape ...

item.title: Why Malcolm Gladwell decided it was time for ‘Revenge’
item.description: From bank robberies to the opioid crisis, Malcolm Gladwell's 'Revenge of the Tipping Point,' digs into why epidemics spread around America.
